Draw line 1 from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). 2. Draw line 2 from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.5543). 3. Draw line 3 from (0.75, 0.5543) to (0.0, 0.5543). 4. Draw line 4 from (0.0, 0.5543) to (0.0, 0.0) to close the loop. Scale the 2D sketch using a factor of 0.75. Create a 3D sketch from the scaled 2D sketch and perform a rotation transformation based on the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D model with the following properties: * Extrusion depth towards normal: 0.0163 * Extrusion depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch Scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body The resulting part will have the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.0163 * Height: 0.75 Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Rectangular Hole Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.1793, 0.0163, 0.1141] Create four new sketches for each face of the coordinate system. For all sketches, perform the following steps: 1. Draw circle 1 with a Center at: * Face 1: [0.0163, 0.2446] * Face 2: [0.3098, 0.0163] * Face 3: [0.3098, 0.2446] * Face 4: [0.4728, 0.0163] 2. Set the radius for all circles to 0.0163 Scale the 2D sketch using a factor of 0.4891. Create a 3D sketch from the scaled 2D sketch and perform a rotation transformation based on the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D model with the following properties: * Extrusion depth towards normal: 0.0163 * Extrusion depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch Scale: 0.4891 * Operation: Join the current model to the previous one The resulting part will have the following dimensions: * Length: 0.4891 * Width: 0.0163 * Height: 0.4891 This is the final CAD model, ready for any further refinements and modifications.</description>

Extrusion With the sketch complete, extrude it along the Z-axis with the properties mentioned below: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.4137 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.75 This operation effectively creates a 3D prism with the specified height, length, and width.
